member.name: M:Saltarelle.IScriptManagerService.GetUniqueId
member.summary: Get a uniqe id, suitable for assignment to a new control.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.IScriptManagerService.RegisterTopLevelControl(System.String,Saltarelle.IControl)
member.summary: Register a control as a top level control. This means that its constructor will get called on page load. The control can later be retrieved using the method.
member.param: Key with which the control can later be retrieved by the method.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.IScriptManagerService.GetTopLevelControl(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a control previously registered by the method. Returns null if the control has not been registered.
member.param: ID under which the control to return is registered as.
member.returns: The registered control, or null if the control has not been registered.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.IScriptManagerService.EnsureScriptIncluded(System.String)
member.summary: Ensure that a script is included. If the script is already included, nothing will happend, if not, it will be synchronously loaded

member.name: M:Saltarelle.InstantiatedTemplateControl.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: This constructor should only be used for initialization on load

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.jquery
member.summary: The current version of jQuery.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.size
member.summary: Get the number of elements currently matched. This returns the same number as the 'length' property of the jQuery object.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.get
member.summary:
Access all matched DOM elements. This serves as a backwards-compatible way of accessing all matched elements (other than the jQuery object itself, which is, in fact, an array of elements).
It is useful if you need to operate on the DOM elements themselves instead of using built-in jQuery functions.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.get(System.Int32)
member.summary: Access a single matched DOM element at a specified index in the matched set. This allows you to extract the actual DOM element and operate on it directly without necessarily using jQuery functionality on it.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.pushStack(System.DHTML.DOMElement[])
member.summary: Set the jQuery object to an array of elements, while maintaining the stack.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.setArray(System.DHTML.DOMElement[])
member.summary: Set the jQuery object to an array of elements. This operation is completely destructive - be sure to use .pushStack() if you wish to maintain the jQuery stack.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.each(Saltarelle.EachCallback)
member.summary:
Execute a function within the context of every matched element. This means that every time the passed-in function is executed (which is once for every element matched) the 'this' keyword points to the specific DOM element.
Additionally, the function, when executed, is passed a single argument representing the position of the element in the matched set (integer, zero-index).

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.index(System.DHTML.DOMElement)
member.summary: Searches every matched element for the object and returns the index of the element, if found, starting with zero. Returns -1 if the object wasn't found.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.attr(System.String)
member.summary:
Access a property on the first matched element. This method makes it easy to retrieve a property value from the first matched element.
If the element does not have an attribute with such a name, undefined is returned.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.attr(System.Object)
member.summary:
Set a key/value object as properties to all matched elements.
This serves as the best way to set a large number of properties on all matched elements.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.attr(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Set a single property to a value, on all matched elements.
Note that you can't set the name property of input elements in IE. Use $(html) or .append(html) or .html(html) to create elements on the fly including the name property.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.attr(System.String,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Set a single property to a computed value, on all matched elements.
Instead of supplying a string value as described [[DOM/Attributes#attr.28_key.2C_value_.29|above]], a function is provided that computes the value.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.css(System.String)
member.summary: Access a style property on the first matched element. This method makes it easy to retrieve a style property value from the first matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.css(System.Object)
member.summary:
Set a key/value object as style properties to all matched elements.
This serves as the best way to set a large number of style properties on all matched elements.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.css(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set a single style property to a value, on all matched elements. If a number is provided, it is automatically converted into a pixel value.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.css(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set a single style property to a value, on all matched elements. If a number is provided, it is automatically converted into a pixel value.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.text
member.summary: Get the text contents of all matched elements. The result is a string that contains the combined text contents of all matched elements. This method works on both HTML and XML documents.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.text(System.String)
member.summary:
Set the text contents of all matched elements.
Similar to html(), but escapes HTML (replace "<" and ">" with their HTML entities).

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.wrap(System.String)
member.summary:
Wrap all matched elements with a structure of other elements. This wrapping process is most useful for injecting additional stucture into a document, without ruining the original semantic qualities of a document.
This works by going through the first element provided (which is generated, on the fly, from the provided HTML) and finds the deepest ancestor element within its structure - it is that element that will en-wrap everything else.
This does not work with elements that contain text. Any necessary text must be added after the wrapping is done.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.wrap(System.DHTML.DOMElement)
member.summary:
Wrap all matched elements with a structure of other elements. This wrapping process is most useful for injecting additional stucture into a document, without ruining the original semantic qualities of a document.
This works by going through the first element provided and finding the deepest ancestor element within its structure - it is that element that will en-wrap everything else.
This does not work with elements that contain text. Any necessary text must be added after the wrapping is done.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.append(System.Object)
member.summary:
Append content to the inside of every matched element.
This operation is similar to doing an appendChild to all the specified elements, adding them into the document.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.prepend(System.Object)
member.summary:
Prepend content to the inside of every matched element.
This operation is the best way to insert elements inside, at the beginning, of all matched elements.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.before(System.Object)
member.summary: Insert content before each of the matched elements.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.after(System.Object)
member.summary: Insert content after each of the matched elements.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.end
member.summary:
Revert the most recent 'destructive' operation, changing the set of matched elements to its previous state (right before the destructive operation).
If there was no destructive operation before, an empty set is returned.
A 'destructive' operation is any operation that changes the set of matched jQuery elements. These functions are: add, children, clone, filter, find, not, next, parent, parents, prev and siblings.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.find(System.String)
member.summary:
Searches for all elements that match the specified expression. This method is a good way to find additional descendant elements with which to process.
All searching is done using a jQuery expression. The expression can be written using CSS 1-3 Selector syntax, or basic XPath.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.clone
member.summary:
Clone matched DOM Elements and select the clones.
This is useful for moving copies of the elements to another location in the DOM.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Clone matched DOM Elements and select the clones.
This is useful for moving copies of the elements to another location in the DOM.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.filter(System.String)
member.summary:
Removes all elements from the set of matched elements that do not match the specified expression(s). This method is used to narrow down the results of a search.
Provide a comma-separated list of expressions to apply multiple filters at once.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.filter(Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary: Removes all elements from the set of matched elements that do not pass the specified filter. This method is used to narrow down the results of a search.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.not(System.DHTML.DOMElement)
member.summary: Removes the specified Element from the set of matched elements. This method is used to remove a single Element from a jQuery object.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.not(System.String)
member.summary: Removes elements matching the specified expression from the set of matched elements. This method is used to remove one or more elements from a jQuery object.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.not(Saltarelle.jQuery)
member.summary:
Removes any elements inside the array of elements from the set of matched elements. This method is used to remove one or more elements from a jQuery object.
Please note: the expression cannot use a reference to the element name. See the two examples below.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds more elements, matched by the given expression, to the set of matched elements.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.add(System.DHTML.DOMElement)
member.summary: Adds one or more Elements to the set of matched elements.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.add(System.DHTML.DOMElement[])
member.summary: Adds one or more Elements to the set of matched elements.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.isInExpression(System.String)
member.summary:
Checks the current selection against an expression and returns true, if at least one element of the selection fits the given expression.
Does return false, if no element fits or the expression is not valid.
filter(String) is used internally, therefore all rules that apply there apply here, too.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.val
member.summary:
Get the content of the value attribute of the first matched element.
Use caution when relying on this function to check the value of multiple-select elements and checkboxes in a form. While it will still work as intended, it may not accurately represent the value the server will receive because these elements may send an array of values. For more robust handling of field values, see the [http://www.malsup.com/jquery/form/#fields fieldValue function of the Form Plugin].

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.val(System.String)
member.summary: Set the value attribute of every matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.html
member.summary: Get the html contents of the first matched element. This property is not available on XML documents.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.html(System.String)
member.summary: Set the html contents of every matched element. This property is not available on XML documents.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.parent(System.String)
member.summary:
Get a set of elements containing the unique parents of the matched set of elements.
You may use an optional expression to filter the set of parent elements that will match.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.parent
member.summary:
Get a set of elements containing the unique parents of the matched set of elements.
You may use an optional expression to filter the set of parent elements that will match.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.parents(System.String)
member.summary:
Get a set of elements containing the unique ancestors of the matched set of elements (except for the root element).
The matched elements can be filtered with an optional expression.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.next(System.String)
member.summary:
Get a set of elements containing the unique next siblings of each of the matched set of elements.
It only returns the very next sibling for each element, not all next siblings.
You may provide an optional expression to filter the match.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.next
member.summary:
Get a set of elements containing the unique next siblings of each of the matched set of elements.
It only returns the very next sibling for each element, not all next siblings.
You may provide an optional expression to filter the match.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.prev(System.String)
member.summary:
Get a set of elements containing the unique previous siblings of each of the matched set of elements.
Use an optional expression to filter the matched set.
Only the immediately previous sibling is returned, not all previous siblings.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.prev
member.summary:
Get a set of elements containing the unique previous siblings of each of the matched set of elements.
Use an optional expression to filter the matched set.
Only the immediately previous sibling is returned, not all previous siblings.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.siblings(System.String)
member.summary:
Get a set of elements containing all of the unique siblings of each of the matched set of elements.
Can be filtered with an optional expressions.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.children(System.String)
member.summary:
Get a set of elements containing all of the unique children of each of the matched set of elements.
This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.children
member.summary:
Get a set of elements containing all of the unique children of each of the matched set of elements.
This set can be filtered with an optional expression that will cause only elements matching the selector to be collected.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.appendTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Append all of the matched elements to another, specified, set of elements. This operation is, essentially, the reverse of doing a regular $(A).append(B), in that instead of appending B to A, you're appending A to B.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.prependTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Prepend all of the matched elements to another, specified, set of elements. This operation is, essentially, the reverse of doing a regular $(A).prepend(B), in that instead of prepending B to A, you're prepending A to B.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.insertBefore(System.Object)
member.summary: Insert all of the matched elements before another, specified, set of elements. This operation is, essentially, the reverse of doing a regular $(A).before(B), in that instead of inserting B before A, you're inserting A before B.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.insertAfter(System.Object)
member.summary: Insert all of the matched elements after another, specified, set of elements. This operation is, essentially, the reverse of doing a regular $(A).after(B), in that instead of inserting B after A, you're inserting A after B.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.removeAttr(System.String)
member.summary: Remove an attribute from each of the matched elements.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.addClass(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified class(es) to each of the set of matched elements.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.removeClass(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all or the specified class(es) from the set of matched elements.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.toggleClass(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified class if it is not present, removes it if it is present.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.remove(System.String)
member.summary:
Removes all matched elements from the DOM. This does NOT remove them from the jQuery object, allowing you to use the matched elements further.
Can be filtered with an optional expressions.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.empty
member.summary: Removes all child nodes from the set of matched elements.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.eq(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reduce the set of matched elements to a single element. The position of the element in the set of matched elements starts at 0 and goes to length - 1.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.contains(System.String)
member.summary: Filter the set of elements to those that contain the specified text.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.width
member.summary: Get the current computed, pixel, width of the first matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.width(System.String)
member.summary: Set the CSS width of every matched element. If no explicit unit was specified (like 'em' or '%') then "px" is added to the width.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.width(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the CSS width of every matched element. If no explicit unit was specified (like 'em' or '%') then "px" is added to the width.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.height
member.summary: Get the current computed, pixel, height of the first matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.height(System.String)
member.summary: Set the CSS height of every matched element. If no explicit unit was specified (like 'em' or '%') then "px" is added to the width.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.height(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the CSS height of every matched element. If no explicit unit was specified (like 'em' or '%') then "px" is added to the width.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.bind(System.String,System.Object,System.Delegate)
member.summary:
Binds a handler to a particular event (like click) for each matched element. The event handler is passed an event object that you can use to prevent default behaviour. To stop both default action and event bubbling, your handler has to return false.
In most cases, you can define your event handlers as anonymous functions (see first example). In cases where that is not possible, you can pass additional data as the second parameter (and the handler function as the third), see second example.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.one(System.String,System.Object,System.Delegate)
member.summary:
Binds a handler to a particular event (like click) for each matched element. The handler is executed only once for each element. Otherwise, the same rules as described in bind() apply. The event handler is passed an event object that you can use to prevent default behaviour. To stop both default action and event bubbling, your handler has to return false.
In most cases, you can define your event handlers as anonymous functions (see first example). In cases where that is not possible, you can pass additional data as the second paramter (and the handler function as the third), see second example.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.unbind(System.String,System.Delegate)
member.summary:
The opposite of bind, removes a bound event from each of the matched elements.
Without any arguments, all bound events are removed.
If the type is provided, all bound events of that type are removed.
If the function that was passed to bind is provided as the second argument, only that specific event handler is removed.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.trigger(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Trigger a type of event on every matched element. This will also cause the default action of the browser with the same name (if one exists) to be executed. For example, passing 'submit' to the trigger() function will also cause the browser to submit the form. This default action can be prevented by returning false from one of the functions bound to the event.
You can also trigger custom events registered with bind.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.trigger(System.String)
member.summary:
Trigger a type of event on every matched element. This will also cause the default action of the browser with the same name (if one exists) to be executed. For example, passing 'submit' to the trigger() function will also cause the browser to submit the form. This default action can be prevented by returning false from one of the functions bound to the event.
You can also trigger custom events registered with bind.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.toggle(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate,Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary:
Toggle between two function calls every other click. Whenever a matched element is clicked, the first specified function is fired, when clicked again, the second is fired. All subsequent clicks continue to rotate through the two functions.
Use unbind("click") to remove.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.hover(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate,Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary:
A method for simulating hovering (moving the mouse on, and off, an object). This is a custom method which provides an 'in' to a frequent task.
Whenever the mouse cursor is moved over a matched element, the first specified function is fired. Whenever the mouse moves off of the element, the second specified function fires. Additionally, checks are in place to see if the mouse is still within the specified element itself (for example, an image inside of a div), and if it is, it will continue to 'hover', and not move out (a common error in using a mouseout event handler).

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.ready(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary:
Bind a function to be executed whenever the DOM is ready to be traversed and manipulated. This is probably the most important function included in the event module, as it can greatly improve the response times of your web applications.
In a nutshell, this is a solid replacement for using window.onload, and attaching a function to that. By using this method, your bound function will be called the instant the DOM is ready to be read and manipulated, which is when what 99.99% of all JavaScript code needs to run.
There is one argument passed to the ready event handler: A reference to the jQuery function. You can name that argument whatever you like, and can therefore stick with the $ alias without risk of naming collisions.
Please ensure you have no code in your <body> onload event handler, otherwise $(document).ready() may not fire.
You can have as many $(document).ready events on your page as you like. The functions are then executed in the order they were added.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.scroll(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the scroll event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.submit(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the submit event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.submit
member.summary:
Trigger the submit event of each matched element. This causes all of the functions that have been bound to that submit event to be executed, and calls the browser's default submit action on the matching element(s). This default action can be prevented by returning false from one of the functions bound to the submit event.
Note: This does not execute the submit method of the form element! If you need to submit the form via code, you have to use the DOM method, eg. $("form")[0].submit();

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.focus(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the focus event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.focus
member.summary:
Trigger the focus event of each matched element. This causes all of the functions that have been bound to thet focus event to be executed.
Note: This does not execute the focus method of the underlying elements! If you need to focus an element via code, you have to use the DOM method, eg. $("#myinput")[0].focus();

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.keydown(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the keydown event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.dblclick(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the dblclick event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.keypress(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the keypress event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.error(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the error event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.blur(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the blur event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.blur
member.summary:
Trigger the blur event of each matched element. This causes all of the functions that have been bound to that blur event to be executed, and calls the browser's default blur action on the matching element(s). This default action can be prevented by returning false from one of the functions bound to the blur event.
Note: This does not execute the blur method of the underlying elements! If you need to blur an element via code, you have to use the DOM method, eg. $("#myinput")[0].blur();

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.load(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the load event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.select(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the select event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.select
member.summary: Trigger the select event of each matched element. This causes all of the functions that have been bound to that select event to be executed, and calls the browser's default select action on the matching element(s). This default action can be prevented by returning false from one of the functions bound to the select event.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.mouseup(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the mouseup event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.unload(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the unload event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.change(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the change event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.mouseout(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the mouseout event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.keyup(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the keyup event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.click(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the click event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.click
member.summary: Trigger the click event of each matched element. This causes all of the functions that have been bound to thet click event to be executed.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.resize(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the resize event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.mousemove(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the mousemove event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.mousedown(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the mousedown event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.mouseover(Saltarelle.JQueryEventHandlerDelegate)
member.summary: Bind a function to the mouseover event of each matched element.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.loadIfModified(System.String,System.Object,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary: Load HTML from a remote file and inject it into the DOM, only if it's been modified by the server.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.load(System.String,System.Object,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Load HTML from a remote file and inject it into the DOM.
Note: Avoid to use this to load scripts, instead use $.getScript. IE strips script tags when there aren't any other characters in front of it.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.serialize
member.summary:
Serializes a set of input elements into a string of data. This will serialize all given elements.
A serialization similar to the form submit of a browser is provided by the [http://www.malsup.com/jquery/form/ Form Plugin]. It also takes multiple-selects into account, while this method recognizes only a single option.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.evalScripts
member.summary: Evaluate all script tags inside this jQuery. If they have a src attribute, the script is loaded, otherwise it's content is evaluated.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.ajaxStart(Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary: Attach a function to be executed whenever an AJAX request begins and there is none already active.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.ajaxStop(Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary: Attach a function to be executed whenever all AJAX requests have ended.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.ajaxComplete(Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Attach a function to be executed whenever an AJAX request completes.
The XMLHttpRequest and settings used for that request are passed as arguments to the callback.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.ajaxSuccess(Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Attach a function to be executed whenever an AJAX request completes successfully.
The XMLHttpRequest and settings used for that request are passed as arguments to the callback.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.ajaxError(Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Attach a function to be executed whenever an AJAX request fails.
The XMLHttpRequest and settings used for that request are passed as arguments to the callback. A third argument, an exception object, is passed if an exception occured while processing the request.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.ajaxSend(Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Attach a function to be executed before an AJAX request is sent.
The XMLHttpRequest and settings used for that request are passed as arguments to the callback.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.show
member.summary: Displays each of the set of matched elements if they are hidden.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.show(System.String,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Show all matched elements using a graceful animation and firing an optional callback after completion.
The height, width, and opacity of each of the matched elements are changed dynamically according to the specified speed.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.show(System.Int32,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Show all matched elements using a graceful animation and firing an optional callback after completion.
The height, width, and opacity of each of the matched elements are changed dynamically according to the specified speed.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.hide
member.summary: Hides each of the set of matched elements if they are shown.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.hide(System.String,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Hide all matched elements using a graceful animation and firing an optional callback after completion.
The height, width, and opacity of each of the matched elements are changed dynamically according to the specified speed.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.hide(System.Int32,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Hide all matched elements using a graceful animation and firing an optional callback after completion.
The height, width, and opacity of each of the matched elements are changed dynamically according to the specified speed.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.toggle
member.summary: Toggles each of the set of matched elements. If they are shown, toggle makes them hidden. If they are hidden, toggle makes them shown.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.slideDown(System.String,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Reveal all matched elements by adjusting their height and firing an optional callback after completion.
Only the height is adjusted for this animation, causing all matched elements to be revealed in a "sliding" manner.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.slideDown(System.Int32,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Reveal all matched elements by adjusting their height and firing an optional callback after completion.
Only the height is adjusted for this animation, causing all matched elements to be revealed in a "sliding" manner.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.slideUp(System.String,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Hide all matched elements by adjusting their height and firing an optional callback after completion.
Only the height is adjusted for this animation, causing all matched elements to be hidden in a "sliding" manner.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.slideUp(System.Int32,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Hide all matched elements by adjusting their height and firing an optional callback after completion.
Only the height is adjusted for this animation, causing all matched elements to be hidden in a "sliding" manner.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.slideToggle(System.String,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Toggle the visibility of all matched elements by adjusting their height and firing an optional callback after completion.
Only the height is adjusted for this animation, causing all matched elements to be hidden in a "sliding" manner.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.slideToggle(System.Int32,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Toggle the visibility of all matched elements by adjusting their height and firing an optional callback after completion.
Only the height is adjusted for this animation, causing all matched elements to be hidden in a "sliding" manner.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.fadeIn(System.String,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Fade in all matched elements by adjusting their opacity and firing an optional callback after completion.
Only the opacity is adjusted for this animation, meaning that all of the matched elements should already have some form of height and width associated with them.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.fadeIn(System.Int32,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Fade in all matched elements by adjusting their opacity and firing an optional callback after completion.
Only the opacity is adjusted for this animation, meaning that all of the matched elements should already have some form of height and width associated with them.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.fadeOut(System.String,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Fade out all matched elements by adjusting their opacity and firing an optional callback after completion.
Only the opacity is adjusted for this animation, meaning that all of the matched elements should already have some form of height and width associated with them.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.fadeOut(System.Int32,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Fade out all matched elements by adjusting their opacity and firing an optional callback after completion.
Only the opacity is adjusted for this animation, meaning that all of the matched elements should already have some form of height and width associated with them.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.fadeTo(System.String,System.Int32,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Fade the opacity of all matched elements to a specified opacity and firing an optional callback after completion.
Only the opacity is adjusted for this animation, meaning that all of the matched elements should already have some form of height and width associated with them.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.fadeTo(System.Int32,System.Int32,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
Fade the opacity of all matched elements to a specified opacity and firing an optional callback after completion.
Only the opacity is adjusted for this animation, meaning that all of the matched elements should already have some form of height and width associated with them.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.animate(System.Object,System.String,System.String,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
A function for making your own, custom animations. The key aspect of this function is the object of style properties that will be animated, and to what end. Each key within the object represents a style property that will also be animated (for example: "height", "top", or "opacity").
Note that properties should be specified using camel case eg. marginLeft instead of margin-left.
The value associated with the key represents to what end the property will be animated. If a number is provided as the value, then the style property will be transitioned from its current state to that new number. Otherwise if the string "hide", "show", or "toggle" is provided, a default animation will be constructed for that property.

member.name: M:Saltarelle.jQuery.animate(System.Object,System.Int32,System.String,Saltarelle.BasicCallback)
member.summary:
A function for making your own, custom animations. The key aspect of this function is the object of style properties that will be animated, and to what end. Each key within the object represents a style property that will also be animated (for example: "height", "top", or "opacity").
Note that properties should be specified using camel case eg. marginLeft instead of margin-left.
The value associated with the key represents to what end the property will be animated. If a number is provided as the value, then the style property will be transitioned from its current state to that new number. Otherwise if the string "hide", "show", or "toggle" is provided, a default animation will be constructed for that property.
